author: COMSOL
description: Échelle spectrographs are commonly used in astronomy for high-resolution analyses of stellar atmospheres and for precision Doppler velocimetry. This tutorial simulates a "white pupil" form of this instrument. It makes use of several parts from the Ray Optics Module Part Library and demonstrates the creation of a complex fully parameterized geometry. Two grating components are included, and the use of the Diffraction Order node is demonstrated. The échelle grating is used in high order while the cross dispersion grating is used in first order. The resulting ray, échelle, and spot diagrams are shown.
label: white_pupil_echelle_spectrograph.mph

settings.value: Specify clear aperture diameter and off axis distance

settings.name: commentsinfile
settings.value:
Conic Mirror Off Axis 3D

Off axis conic mirror. The mirror surface may be either concave or convex. The mirror can be either a standard off axis section of a parent mirror, or it can be a standalone section. A clear aperture which is smaller than the mirror surface diameter can be specified.

settings.description: Show as variant in part library
settings.name: partvariant

settings.description: Keep selections by default in instances
settings.name: keepselininstances
commentsinfile
settings.value:
Spherical Lens 3D

Spherical lens with either concave or convex surfaces. The lens surface diameters can be smaller than the outer diameter. Clear apertures which are smaller than the lens surface diameters can be specified.

settings.name: commentsinfile
settings.value:
Circular Planar Annulus

Circular planar annulus with negligible thickness.

settings.name: commentsinfile
settings.value:
Rectangular Planar Annulus

Rectangular planar annulus with negligible thickness.
